result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose I Huertas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Trespass to Land. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 ays or penalty of 2 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose I Huertas in court with attorney Nick Martinez. Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend charge #1 to a county trespassing ordinance.  Defendant pleads no contest to the amended county charge.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FORFEITURE: $267.50 to be paid within 90 days. Failure to pay will result in 2 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Jose I Huertas did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defendant is working on paying the restitution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jose I Huertas in court with attorney Nick Martinez for Jess Martinez.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense was handed materials regarding restitution in court.  Attorney martinez is waiting on discovery.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co defendants, victim/witness/Waukesha Health and Human Services property listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Jose I Huertas in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
